content:
Is there a flag that can be passed to lake build that would print only the messages that arise from building a file, but not which files it is actually building?

E.g. on a file consisting of #eval 0 I would like to see a printout of 0 (decorated with row numbers and file name), but not [1/1] Building <file_name>.

For context, this is intended to be used in CI to make sure that building mathlib is quiet. Currently, I am sifting out those progress lines, but ideally I would like to simply replay the noise and make sure that there isn't any.
I would love this too, but afaik there was no such option the last time I looked into it (which is a few months ago).
Mac is updating all this output, and probably it will land in v4.8.0-rc2 in the next few days.

Ok, thanks for the update!

Should I leave #12886 as is and update it later, or should I come back to it once the flag is available?
